content.text: The Eliza project has seen numerous improvements across different areas. Several bugfixes have been implemented to enhance compatibility and fix issues. Windows compatibility for the Vite dev server was improved (PR #1760), build lint errors were fixed (PR #1759), and line break handling in chat was addressed (PR #1784). Token trimming now supports non-OpenAI models (PR #1605), and the trust provider for PostgreSQL database was disabled (PR #1536). A nonsensical schema check was removed from the postgres-adapter (PR #1377), and vector extension creation is now handled properly in PostgreSQL (PR #1743, later reverted in PR #1799).

Several new features have been added to enhance functionality. The plugin-near module now uses the Eliza logger instead of console.log (PR #1745), and the eternalai provider can now write request/response log information (PR #1740). Echochambers were added to the agent (PR #1719), and custom conditions for live monorepo types are now supported (PR #1365). The Discord client now simulates typing while generating responses (PR #1712), and Google model configurations have been updated (PR #1815). A default export was added to the plugin-image-generation (PR #1831).

Documentation has been expanded with new translations and updates. A Serbian README translation was added (PR #1757), and the Korean README was updated (PR #1739). The FAQ documentation was also updated (PR #1746). Additionally, an Agentic Eliza Plugin Documenter with multilingual support for English, Spanish, and French was introduced (PR #1675).

Various client-specific fixes were implemented. The Slack client now implements Media type properties in message attachments (PR #1741), and the Twitter client standardized the ACTION_INTERVAL unit to minutes (PR #1738). A port issue was fixed where port 80 was not listening, now using port 3000 instead (PR #1616). Multiple web search import in the agent was also fixed (PR #1718).

Maintenance work included removing unused imports from the zksync-era module (PR #1716), replacing console.log with elizaLogger for better logging (PR #1834), updating the .env.example file (PR #1829), and bumping the version to v0.1.7 (PR #1804). The FerePro plugin was removed (PR #1795), and the client API was refactored (PR #1713). The project also saw synchronization between development and main branches (PR #1823, PR #1717).

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository covering various aspects of the system:

1. Performance Issues:
   - Issue #1758 reports very slow pnpm start times
   - Issue #1747 describes a Jetson Runtime Exception with sqlite-vec extension load failure

2. Configuration and Feature Requests:
   - Issue #1772 addresses resolving discrepancies between image models and base models
   - Issue #1813 requests better X Agent configuration options (e.g., disabling retweets and likes)
   - Issue #1809 proposes implementing a PgLite database adapter

3. Documentation and Error Handling:
   - Issue #1720 suggests serving Docusaurus docs from a Docker container for quick verification
   - Issue #1838 reports a broken FAQ link in Contributing.MD
   - Issues #1842 and #1843 (duplicates) request more granular try-catch blocks in the plugin-coinbase component

4. Wallet Integration:
   - Issue #1780 reports a "Public Solana Wallet Not Found" error

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
The elizaOS/eliza repository has seen several recent pull requests that add new features, fix issues, and prepare for releases:

- New blockchain integrations with PR #1764 adding an Injective plugin and PR #1768 adding a Cardano Blockchain Plugin
- Release preparation with PR #1717 merging develop into main for the 1.7.0 release
- Bug fixes including PR #1750 addressing PGVector embedding validation issues and PR #1798 fixing broken CI documentation due to out-of-sync frozen pnpm files
- Feature implementations with PR #1790 (and the related PR #1783) implementing a feature for issue #1725
- Code improvements with PR #1817 focused on reducing modules
- A new contribution labeled as 'Kavi' in PR #1771

These pull requests demonstrate active development across various aspects of the eliza project, from new blockchain integrations to infrastructure improvements and bug fixes.

Current cryptocurrency prices show significant variations between two reporting periods:

WETH: Price increased from $3,450.38 to $3,605.40 (+4.5%)
SOL: Price increased from $208.04 to $217.83 (+4.7%)
WBTC: Price increased from $96,643.07 to $97,824.68 (+1.2%)
ai16z: Price decreased from $2.37 to $2.10 (-11.6%)

While WETH, SOL, and WBTC all showed positive price movement, ai16z experienced a notable decline.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From January 3-4, 2025, there were 43 new pull requests with 14 merged, 24 new issues created, and 69 active contributors. The following day (January 4-5, 2025) saw 46 new pull requests with 21 merged, 18 new issues, and 61 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained strong development momentum with a high number of contributors and an increasing PR merge rate.
